page.title: 05Fishing From Gourdon
page.content: The fishing population of the village has become greatly reduced especially with the discovery of oil in the{North {Sea,}many of the male population now working in oil related industries.In Gourdon there are 4 {trawlers}sailing out from the harbour at the moment. The most popular fishing however is{creel fishing because there are 12 of these boats but there are some of those which go to both creel fishing and{line {fishing.}Line fishing is using hooks and a thin rope which is held down by weights. Only one boat goes{prawn {fishing}at the present time and there are only 2{seine net boats. Gourdon is a{tidal harbour}which means the tide goes out and in twice a day. This affects the fishermen who have to wait for high tide and sail at all different times of the day and night.
